Module com.augursolutions.wordler
Package com.augursolutions.wordler

Class Dictionary

java.lang.Object
com.augursolutions.wordler.Dictionary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Word>
public class Dictionary extends Object implements Iterable<Word>
Dictionary implemented as an M-ary tree with Word objects attached to each WORD_ENDING node. All letters are stored in upper-case, so that Dicionary.add("foo") and Dicionary.add("FOO") are equivalent. Only letters are allowed.

Each node in the tree is one letter in one or more words, with the ASCII `start of text` value (02) used for the root node and the `end of text` value (03) used for nodes that indicate the end of a word. Note that each node can have at most 27 children (A-Z and `end of text`). The children for each node are stored in a TreeMap so that values are retrieved in alphabetical order.

As an example, consider a Dictionary object with the words "AT", "BE", "BED", and "BEST". The associated tree would look like the image below, with (R) indicating the root node and (E) indicating nodes that mark the end of a word. 

     A-T-(E)
    /
 (R) 
    \
     B   (E)
      \ / 
       E-D-(E)  
        \
         S-T-(E)
Each word ending node is linked to a Word object that contains the spelling of the word as well as the definition and part(s) of speech (if provided when the dictionary is created)

For a more streamlined implementation that allows all characters (excluding the reserved ASCII values 02 and 03), use the SimpleDictionary class

Author:
Steven Major

      public Dictionary()

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Gets the number of words in the dictionary (specifically the number of nodes whose letter is DictionaryNode.WORD_ENDING
      Returns:
      number of words in the dictionary

    • getRootNode

      public Dictionary.DictionaryNode getRootNode()
      Gets the root node - if none exists, creates a new empty node as the root.
      Returns:
      The root node of the Dictionary

    • setSeed

      public void setSeed(int seed)
      Sets the random seed for the getRandomWord() and getRandomWord(Word[]) methods
      Parameters:
      seed - Any int is valid

    • getNode

      public Dictionary.DictionaryNode getNode(String wordFragment)
      Get the Dictionary.DictionaryNode associated with a word fragment. For example, if the word "DOG" is in the Dictionary, then getNode("DO") will return the node whose letter is "O" with parent "D" and child "G" (other children may be present)
      Parameters:
      wordFragment - partial word (can be full word) to fetch the node for.
      Returns:
      Corresponding node of the last letter in wordFragment. NULL if the word fragment is not in the dictionary.

    • getWord

      public Word getWord(String word)
      Return the Word object (if the word exists in the dictionary) associated with the word. If the word is not in the dictionary, returns null. Match is case-insensitive
      Parameters:
      word - Word to fetch from the Dictionary
      Returns:
      Word object with the matched word Returns null if no matching word was found in the dictionary.

    • addWord

      public boolean addWord(Word word)
      Add a word to the Dictionary; the Dictionary object is modified in the process.
      Parameters:
      word - Word to be added to the Dictionary
      Returns:
      true if the Word is added (false if the word already exists or if word is null or otherwise invalid)

    • addWord

      public void addWord(String word)
      Wrapper for addWord(Word) for adding words with no definition
      Parameters:
      word - Word (letters only - no definition or parts of speech) to add to the dictionary

    • removeWord

      public void removeWord(String word)
      Remove a word from the Dictionary; the Dictionary object is modified in the process. If word is not present in the dictionary, it is left unmodified
      Parameters:
      word - Word to be removed from the Dictionary

    • printAll

      public void printAll()
      Prints every word in the Dictionary to the console in alphabetical order. Uses recursion.

    • printAll

      public void printAll(Dictionary.DictionaryNode node)
      Prints every word in the Dictionary that has node as its parent.
      Parameters:
      node - Current node in the recursion

    • getRandomWord

      public Word getRandomWord()
      Get a random Word from the dictionary - all words are equally likely to be retrieved regardless of size
      Returns:
      A randomly chosen Word

    • getRandomWord

      public Word getRandomWord(Word[] lookupTable)
      Returns a randomly chosen member of the provided lookupTable array. Ideally, this is generated by calling getRandomWordLookupTable() first and then passing the array from that call in to this method with each call.
      Parameters:
      lookupTable - Array of Word objects
      Returns:
      a randomly chosen member of the provided lookupTable array

    • getRandomWordLookupTable

      public Word[] getRandomWordLookupTable()
      Generate an array with every Word in the Dictionary. This is not efficient from a memory stand-point but allows for fast generation of random words from the dictionary
      Returns:
      An array with every Word in the dictionary (in alphabetical order)

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Word> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<Word>

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
